turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking to buy a new pair of noise-canceling headphones, but I'm on a pretty tight budget. I'd prefer to keep it under $150. Can you help me find something good?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! I can definitely help with that. Based on your budget of under $150, I recommend checking out the Sony WH-CH720N or the Anker Soundcore Q30. Both are well-regarded for their noise cancellation capabilities and usually fall within your price range. Would you like me to provide links to those products?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, those both look decent, but honestly, I've seen some reviews that say the noise cancellation on the Anker isn't *that* good, even though it's cheaper. Do you have any recommendations that might offer *better* noise cancellation, even if it means I'm pushing my budget a bit?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a valid concern! While the Q30 offers good value, you're right, the noise cancellation isn't top-tier. To get significantly better noise cancellation, you might need to stretch your budget. The Bose QuietComfort 45 is often considered the gold standard, but it's usually closer to the $300 range. A potentially suitable alternative, and one that often has sales, is the Jabra Elite 85h. They sometimes go on sale and come in around $180, but I can't guarantee the exact price at this moment. I will note, however, that it's possible those aren't available in all regions.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Thanks, that helps! I'll keep an eye out for the Jabra on sale. I appreciate the advice on balancing price and quality. I feel like I'm getting somewhere with this!
